Event.Graphic: Actually, I wouldn't be here if it weren't for Tatjana.
Even though she had nothing to with the whole thing.
Is what I'm talking about hard to follow?
Tatjana Cosic isn't even part of the story.
The prettiest girl in the world plays no part.
For summer last year we went to the sea.
We were stuck in our rubber dingy.
The paddles were in the water.
It got pretty hot in the sun.
Luckily the coast guard got us out.
Put in some effort next time, Justin.
My mother and the beauty farm. By Maik Klingenberg.
I like my mother. She's not like other mothers.
She won the club championship even with a bottle of vodka in her system.
Are you in the summer match, Mrs. Klingenberg?
Then somebody at the table who didn't know the phrase
always threw out the clever quip:
You don't need help with that, Mrs. Klingenberg.
That's a joke. It's a rehab facility.
We'd walk home hand in hand
since she was no longer capable of driving.
I carried her heavy racket bag and she said to me,
"You can't learn much from me. But two things you can learn:"
"Second, what others think doesn't mean shit."
I get that my mother is my mother.
Your story was the most sickening, unsavory, and shameless.
I've encountered in 30 years of teaching.
You should rip these pages out.
I don't mean literally, I mean think about what you've done
Quite clearly, I'd made a big mistake.
But I didn't know what I'd done wrong.
Wagenbach didn't tell me, and I still don't know.
But all I could think about was Tatjana's birthday.
It was all anybody talked about.
I heard Tatjana's uncle is bringing his own beer tap with 100 liters.
Wow! I already ordered condoms on Amazon.
Word was that everyone would be invited.
I tried desperately to think of a present for her.
It had to be something special. But I couldn't come up with anything
And then I hit on an idea.
... the bankruptcy guy? That jerk can kiss my ass.
Hey, Maik, there's a front door too.
Do you know what I'm going to do to those eco-fascists?
I guess I wanted her to see I put a lot of effort into it.
If you put in a lot of effort, people guess why.
Ladies and gentlemen, may I have your attention please,
Would you like to tell us about yourself, where you're from?
Or would you rather I not?
Tschi-chow is our new classmate's name,
and he's from the vast expanses of Russia.
Right away I couldn't stand Tschick.
Tschick was trash, and he looked the part.
I had a rotten feeling about him up there with Wagenbach:
two assholes for the price of one.
... now he's here at our high school.
And all that in just four years.
Isn't that something? Was that right?
We can't have you up here all day, as nice as it is chatting with you.
in the second row next to Maik Klingenberg.
Laila, could you please wipe the blackboard?
And so, everyone take out their notebooks...
A scent wafted over that almost knocked me over.
It was the smell of my mother on a bad day.
Something just had to happ after his performance with Wagenbach.
It was sure to be interesting.
But then nothing happened in the next few days.
Then a week later, we got our math test back.
One of you got an A+.
Go to the board and show us how you solved problem 2.
That fired up the rumor machine:
like that Tschick's family was Russian mafia.
There was no other explanation for how
he shut that fool down with just few words.
Then, on the last day of school...
I'd have been the happiest guy in the universe
if finally an invite found its way to me...
Give it here. It's for me.
Everyone had a little green invite.
No invite for the psycho or the weirdo.
Here's your invite. I hope you can make it.
I'd be so disappointed if you, of all people, couldn't make it.
I hope you thought of my present.
Of course, I can depend on you!
It's my favorite. Not for sale.
Hey, wait up! Where are you going?
No idea? If I'm bugging you, say the word.
You don't know if I bug you? -I don't know if I got Ds.
You didn't check your report card?
-What are you up to now? -Going home.
I'm going back to the beauty farm tomorrow.
14 days or so. Is that all right?
So you don't get into trouble.
Why do you hang in here?
How much do you think it cost me?
What are you doing for summer?
Don't feel sorry for this guy.
Maik, this is Mona. We work together.
You look like a homo whose garden got shat all over.
-You want to go to jail? -I'm only 14, man.
Come on, Maik, let's go for a spin.
My father dragged us here two years ago.
My dad wanted to build houses here.
But they found three extinct bugs and a rare frog.
So, no permit. He only built this house.
It now belongs to the bank.
In a pinch, go to the last safe spot.
I thought I was the only one.
and Sarah with the big tits.
Because you don't care about girls.
The whole class is hot for Tatjana.
You're the only one not staring at her ass,
Did you notice I'm in a bad mood?
A minute ago you didn't feel like it.
Do what? Go to Tatjana and say,
"I don't mind at all you didn't invite me."
"No problem. I was just passing by."
"Enjoy the drawing that I just worked my ass off on."
That's exactly what I would do.
-I drive like a champ. -Then signal like a champ
We're not going to the party, just driving by, okay?
Know why Tatjana didn't invite you?
You don't stand out. You gotta get noticed.
Look, it's Lukas and Justin, retards.
We don't go in. We said just drive by.
No thanks, we've got stuff to do.
Should I give them a show?
What if we just kept driving?
I have a grandfather in Wallachia.
Not the middle of nowhere, in Wallachia.
Wallachia is just a word, like East Bumfuck.
Saying someone lives in Wallachia means they live in the boondocks.
-In the boondocks, really? -You're getting on my nerves.
He lives in a place called Wallachia.
So, are you Russian? Or Wallachian
Yeah, but where are you from?
My family is from all over.
Jewish Gypsies, there's no such thing.
That's like saying there are English French.
There are Jewish French and Jewish Gypsies.
Either you're a Jew or a Gypsy.
Jewish is a religion. A Gypsy is just someone without a home.
Any cocksucker can find us with that.
Want to get scraped off the side of the road?
Don't we have a map? No phone, no map!
We just have to drive south.
I couldn't see 'cause of the fog.
Say it, how old are you? You chicken!
He's calling the police! Tschick, exit!
I forgot to turn on the lights.
You don't look like Kevin Kur√°nyi!
You look like a 14-year-old with duct tape on your silly mug.
You do know that with a watch you can tell the direction?
Here, aim one hand at the sun
-Since when is the sun in the north? -Right now.
the sun rises in the east, moves south and sets in the west.
It doesn't work in summer. Turn it back an hour.
But the directions don't spin around.
A gyrocompass doesn't spin like a gyroscope.
I read it in a book.
A sailor breaks open the compass 'cause he's an alcoholic,
and then they all get lost.
The book was "The Sea Bear" or "The Sea Wolf"...
So we can read it on Google Earth!
Now snake around for the S.
You losers, get out of the way!
-Hurry up! -The cows are in the way!
Put the pedal to the metal, dude!
We've got to get the Lada off the roads for a couple of days.
You brought cans but no can opener?
Goal for Mario G√∂tze! It's all over now!
And the brain at the end?
Somewhere up there, on one of those stars,
there's a good chance even for the slimmest odds...
about two kids who steal a car.
And they're thinking the same thing.
Where's the orphanage you escaped from?
We didn't, we're Mobile Nobles, traveling from manor to manor.
I think your baron is calling.
Don't we have anything to eat?
I thought we were hiding the Lada.
A guy's gotta eat, or he'll die.
Hey, I asked you a question.
-We don't go to the supermarket. -But where is it?
-We buy food from family Fr√∂hlich. -Oh, the Fr√∂hlichs.
Are you just going to have a look?
Do you go to a supermarket just to look?
Do you know where Norma is?
They want to buy food, mommy!
Oh! We never go there. We go to the Fr√∂hlichs.
We're about to have lunch. Join us.
-What's for lunch, my dear lady? -Risi Bisi.
We hold hands in prayer and thank God for his care,
the beautiful Earth where everything grows...
Wait, I have to think of one.
What did Merope Gaunt get for Slytherin's locket...
What was the name of the ship
Who was the first president of Germany?
Now you can ask a question.
Here's a melon. It's good for when you get thirsty too.
Now I have a quiz question:
How do you figure out where north is by using a watch?
Aim your hour hand at the sun, then wind the minute hand to 12,
Don't make it worse for yourself!
I was 100km, maybe 200km, south of Berlin.
Tschick just drove off in the light blue Lada that every cop was now after.
I had no idea how we would find each other again.
Normally, I guess you'd try to meet up
at the spot you'd lost each other.
the village sheriff was waiting there.
If you can't meet where you'd last seen each other,
you go back to the last safe spot you'd been together.
The more I thought about it,
the more convinced I was that Tschick would have the same idea.
-Where did you get the license plate? -Munich.
Where are we gonna get gas?
What if we just steal another car?
We can't steal a new car every time we run out of gas.
Then that's the end of our trip.
I wanted to take the Lada back.
We just have to get gas from another car.
Your friend is a moron too!
Shove it up your ass and shut up!
-Russian pansy! -I'm about to come up there!
Come on up, pussy! Oh, I'm so scared!
She's not right in the head.
What do you need it for?
It's a birthday present for my father.
I showed you where the crap was, now tell me why you want it.
Now we have to steal gas.
Even though I showed you them!
Go ahead, do want you want.
-Got anything to eat? -Do we look like we do?
I'm going to Prague. It's on the way.
You stink like a pile of shit. Piss off.
You didn't have to tell her she stinks.
She had pretty eyes, but she was a weirdo.
Ever heard of gravity? It won't flow up!
Once it's started, overall it flows downward.
But the gas doesn't know that!
It's got a name, something force.
-You never saw it in a movie? -Yeah, in a movie.
It's wet. There's got to be gas.
-Ever heard of sucking? We were sucking!
Didn't you ever steal gas in Russia?
Why didn't it work for us?
This has to be below the water level.
Why are you going to Prague?
I have to visit my half-sister.
There are things living in there.
Ever notice that a mirror switches left and right, but not up and down?
I do feel a bit sor...
I want you to cut my hair.
I don't care. I want it all off.
I don't want a hairy T-shirt.
Taking a vacation. Just like normal people do.
Like us in a hundred years.
-At, mk, is... i like it. -I like it too.
Someone just needs to scratch in some letters,
Let's cut our fingers, and smear our blood on it.
No, dude, I'm a Jewish Gypsy.
I'll send it to you, I swear!
I'll never make it with you guys.
You didn't fall in love again, did you?
you have a way with women.
And we're singing in the fallout shelter,
Hurrah, this world goes helter skelter!
Hurrah, this world goes helter skelter!
Here we go, here we go!
-No way. you drive. -Have you lost your mind?
You just hit the gas and steer. I'll shift.
I'm a coward and I'm boring.
I haven't been bored with you.
Not you, but Tatjana didn't even invite me to her stupid party.
Compared to Isa, Tatjana is brain dead.
I never told anybody that before.
Think of me what you please, but I wasn't particularly surprised.
For a moment I even thought about becoming gay myself.
That would have solved all my problems. But I couldn't.
I just liked girls too much.
Just step on the clutch, left pedal.
La laa, la la laa la la laa laa...
Should I try the emergency lane?
-If you think you can. -Yeah, just like "GTA."
When I get my hands on you...
Or they'll put me in an orphanage.
-I'm not criminally accountable yet. -Oh, yes you are.
-You don't get a thing, you idiot! -I'm not an idiot.
No, your Russian buddy screwed up
That antisocial asshole, he screwed up!
You're too dumb to adjust a rearview mirror.
You keep your mouth shut at the hearing.
The lawyer will tell the judge exactly what happened.
Stealing the car was his idea.
He was also at the wheel when the accident occurred.
My client went along because he was afraid of Andrej.
We both decided to drive off with the Lada.
And I was driving on the autobahn.
I'll ask if I want to hear from you.
At school they tell us violence is never the answer.
When you get sucker punched like that
you know damn well it's an answer.
I thought about how things would be.
How long we'd live in this house,
how long my parents would stay married,
if my father would have kids with Mona...
I know exactly what I thought as I held my breath under water.
I thought there were a lot worse things than having an alcoholic mother.
Because you can't hold your breath forever,
but for a pretty long time.
And that was the summer. School started again.
I have to get to school. It's the first day back.
I got nothing to do with that, officer.
I'm doing civil service with the retards all day.
Tschick could have written a letter.
But to total a Lada just to drop me a line,
... as well as the Pythagorean Theorem.
Tatjana Cosic had finally seen me.
Before this summer I'd have jumped for joy.
But strangely, now I didn't care.
The only thing I cared about s seeing Tschick again.
I thought without Tschick I never would have had the summer we did,
and that it was a cool summer.
-At, mk, is... i like it. -I like it too.
Someone just needs to scratch in some letters,
I was so excited to see Tschick again soon.
If not next week, maybe a little later.
Let's meet up in 50 years at this exact spot.
